moduleSpec.name: MplArtistProperties
moduleSpec.docstring: Abstract base class for someone who renders into a :class:`FigureCanvas`.

inputPortSpec.name: picker
inputPortSpec.docstring:
Set the epsilon for picking used by this artist
picker can be one of the following:
None: picking is disabled for this artist (default)
A boolean: if True then picking will be enabled and the artist will fire a pick event if the mouse event is over the artist
A float: if picker is a number it is interpreted as an epsilon tolerance in points and the artist will fire off an event if it's data is within epsilon of the mouse event. For some artists like lines and patch collections, the artist may provide additional data to the pick event that is generated, e.g. the indices of the data within epsilon of the pick event
A function: if picker is callable, it is a user supplied function which determines whether the artist is hit by the mouse event:
hit, props = picker(artist, mouseevent)
to determine the hit test. if the mouse event is over the artist, return hit=True and props is a dictionary of properties you want added to the PickEvent attributes.

inputPortSpec.name: contains
inputPortSpec.docstring:
Replace the contains test used by this artist. The new picker should be a callable function which determines whether the artist is hit by the mouse event:
hit, props = picker(artist, mouseevent)
If the mouse event is over the artist, return hit = True and props is a dictionary of properties you want returned with the contains test.

inputPortSpec.name: clip_on
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set whether artist uses clipping.

inputPortSpec.name: agg_filter
inputPortSpec.docstring: set agg_filter fuction.

inputPortSpec.name: visible
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the artist's visiblity.

inputPortSpec.name: url
inputPortSpec.docstring: Sets the url for the artist

inputPortSpec.name: transform
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the :class:`~matplotlib.transforms.Transform` instance used by this artist.

inputPortSpec.name: axes
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the :class:`~matplotlib.axes.Axes` instance in which the artist resides, if any.

inputPortSpec.name: clip_box
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the artist's clip :class:`~matplotlib.transforms.Bbox`.

inputPortSpec.name: clip_path
inputPortSpec.docstring:
Set the artist's clip path, which may be:
a :class:`~matplotlib.patches.Patch` (or subclass) instance
None, to remove the clipping path
For efficiency, if the path happens to be an axis-aligned rectangle, this method will set the clipping box to the corresponding rectangle and set the clipping path to None.

inputPortSpec.name: lod
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set Level of Detail on or off. If on, the artists may examine things like the pixel width of the axes and draw a subset of their contents accordingly

inputPortSpec.name: label
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the label to s for auto legend.

inputPortSpec.name: rasterized
inputPortSpec.docstring:
Force rasterized (bitmap) drawing in vector backend output.
Defaults to None, which implies the backend's default behavior

inputPortSpec.name: gid
inputPortSpec.docstring: Sets the (group) id for the artist

inputPortSpec.name: zorder
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the zorder for the artist. Artists with lower zorder values are drawn first.

inputPortSpec.name: snap
inputPortSpec.docstring:
Sets the snap setting which may be:
True: snap vertices to the nearest pixel center
False: leave vertices as-is
None: (auto) If the path contains only rectilinear line segments, round to the nearest pixel center
Only supported by the Agg and MacOSX backends.

inputPortSpec.name: alpha
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the alpha value used for blending - not supported on all backends.

inputPortSpec.name: animated
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the artist's animation state.

inputPortSpec.name: figure
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the :class:`~matplotlib.figure.Figure` instance the artist belongs to.

moduleSpec.name: Mpl_AxesImageBaseProperties
moduleSpec.docstring: None

inputPortSpec.name: resample
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set whether or not image resampling is used

inputPortSpec.name: filternorm
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set whether the resize filter norms the weights -- see help for imshow

inputPortSpec.name: alpha
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the alpha value used for blending - not supported on all backends

inputPortSpec.name: array
inputPortSpec.docstring: Retained for backwards compatibility - use set_data instead

inputPortSpec.name: data
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the image array

inputPortSpec.name: filterrad
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the resize filter radius only applicable to some interpolation schemes -- see help for imshow

inputPortSpec.name: interpolation
inputPortSpec.docstring:
Set the interpolation method the image uses when resizing.
if None, use a value from rc setting. If 'none', the image is shown as is without interpolating. 'none' is only supported in agg, ps and pdf backends and will fall back to 'nearest' mode for other backends.

moduleSpec.name: MplAxesImageProperties
moduleSpec.docstring: None

inputPortSpec.name: extent
inputPortSpec.docstring:
extent is data axes (left, right, bottom, top) for making image plots
This updates ax.dataLim, and, if autoscaling, sets viewLim to tightly fit the image, regardless of dataLim. Autoscaling state is not changed, so following this with ax.autoscale_view will redo the autoscaling in accord with dataLim.

moduleSpec.name: MplNonUniformImageProperties
moduleSpec.docstring: None

inputPortSpec.name: data
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the grid for the pixel centers, and the pixel values.

moduleSpec.name: MplBboxImageProperties
moduleSpec.docstring: The Image class whose size is determined by the given bbox.

moduleSpec.name: MplPcolorImageProperties
moduleSpec.docstring:
Make a pcolor-style plot with an irregular rectangular grid.
This uses a variation of the original irregular image code, and it is used by pcolorfast for the corresponding grid type.

inputPortSpec.name: alpha
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the alpha value used for blending - not supported on all backends

moduleSpec.name: MplFigureImageProperties
moduleSpec.docstring: None

inputPortSpec.name: array
inputPortSpec.docstring: Deprecated; use set_data for consistency with other image types.

inputPortSpec.name: data
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the image array.

moduleSpec.name: MplCollectionProperties
moduleSpec.docstring:
Base class for Collections. Must be subclassed to be usable.
All properties in a collection must be sequences or scalars; if scalars, they will be converted to sequences. The property of the ith element of the collection is::
prop[i % len(props)]
Keyword arguments and default values:
* *edgecolors*: None * *facecolors*: None * *linewidths*: None * *antialiaseds*: None * *offsets*: None * *transOffset*: transforms.IdentityTransform() * *offset_position*: 'screen' (default) or 'data' * *norm*: None (optional for :class:`matplotlib.cm.ScalarMappable`) * *cmap*: None (optional for :class:`matplotlib.cm.ScalarMappable`) * *hatch*: None
*offsets* and *transOffset* are used to translate the patch after rendering (default no offsets). If offset_position is 'screen' (default) the offset is applied after the master transform has been applied, that is, the offsets are in screen coordinates. If offset_position is 'data', the offset is applied before the master transform, i.e., the offsets are in data coordinates.
If any of *edgecolors*, *facecolors*, *linewidths*, *antialiaseds* are None, they default to their :data:`matplotlib.rcParams` patch setting, in sequence form.
The use of :class:`~matplotlib.cm.ScalarMappable` is optional. If the :class:`~matplotlib.cm.ScalarMappable` matrix _A is not None (ie a call to set_array has been made), at draw time a call to scalar mappable will be made to set the face colors.

inputPortSpec.name: edgecolor
inputPortSpec.docstring:
Set the edgecolor(s) of the collection. c can be a matplotlib color arg (all patches have same color), or a sequence of rgba tuples; if it is a sequence the patches will cycle through the sequence.
If c is 'face', the edge color will always be the same as the face color. If it is 'none', the patch boundary will not be drawn.

inputPortSpec.name: offset_position
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set how offsets are applied. If offset_position is 'screen' (default) the offset is applied after the master transform has been applied, that is, the offsets are in screen coordinates. If offset_position is 'data', the offset is applied before the master transform, i.e., the offsets are in data coordinates.

inputPortSpec.name: facecolor
inputPortSpec.docstring:
Set the facecolor(s) of the collection. c can be a matplotlib color arg (all patches have same color), or a sequence of rgba tuples; if it is a sequence the patches will cycle through the sequence.
If c is 'none', the patch will not be filled.

inputPortSpec.name: offsetsSequence
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the offsets for the collection. offsets can be a scalar or a sequence.

inputPortSpec.name: color
inputPortSpec.docstring:
Set both the edgecolor and the facecolor. .. seealso:
:meth:`set_facecolor`, :meth:`set_edgecolor` For setting the edge or face color individually.

inputPortSpec.name: antialiasedSequence
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the antialiasing state for rendering.

inputPortSpec.name: hatch
inputPortSpec.docstring:
Set the hatching pattern
hatch can be one of:
/ - diagonal hatching \ - back diagonal | - vertical - - horizontal + - crossed x - crossed diagonal o - small circle O - large circle . - dots * - stars
Letters can be combined, in which case all the specified hatchings are done. If same letter repeats, it increases the density of hatching of that pattern.
Hatching is supported in the PostScript, PDF, SVG and Agg backends only.
Unlike other properties such as linewidth and colors, hatching can only be specified for the collection as a whole, not separately for each member.

inputPortSpec.name: alpha
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the alpha tranparencies of the collection. alpha must be a float or None.

inputPortSpec.name: linewidthSequence
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the linewidth(s) for the collection. lw can be a scalar or a sequence; if it is a sequence the patches will cycle through the sequence

inputPortSpec.name: linestyle
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the linestyle(s) for the collection.

moduleSpec.name: MplPathCollectionProperties
moduleSpec.docstring: This is the most basic :class:`Collection` subclass.

moduleSpec.name: MplPolyCollectionProperties
moduleSpec.docstring: None

inputPortSpec.name: paths
inputPortSpec.docstring: This allows one to delay initialization of the vertices.

inputPortSpec.name: verts
inputPortSpec.docstring: This allows one to delay initialization of the vertices.

moduleSpec.name: MplBrokenBarHCollectionProperties
moduleSpec.docstring: A collection of horizontal bars spanning *yrange* with a sequence of *xranges*.

moduleSpec.name: MplRegularPolyCollectionProperties
moduleSpec.docstring: Draw a collection of regular polygons with *numsides*.

moduleSpec.name: MplStarPolygonCollectionProperties
moduleSpec.docstring: Draw a collection of regular stars with *numsides* points.

moduleSpec.name: MplAsteriskPolygonCollectionProperties
moduleSpec.docstring: Draw a collection of regular asterisks with *numsides* points.

moduleSpec.name: MplLineCollectionProperties
moduleSpec.docstring:
All parameters must be sequences or scalars; if scalars, they will be converted to sequences. The property of the ith line segment is::
prop[i % len(props)]
i.e., the properties cycle if the ``len`` of props is less than the number of segments.

inputPortSpec.name: color
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the color(s) of the line collection. c can be a matplotlib color arg (all patches have same color), or a sequence or rgba tuples; if it is a sequence the patches will cycle through the sequence.

moduleSpec.name: MplCircleCollectionProperties
moduleSpec.docstring: A collection of circles, drawn using splines.

moduleSpec.name: MplEllipseCollectionProperties
moduleSpec.docstring: A collection of ellipses, drawn using splines.

moduleSpec.name: MplPatchCollectionProperties
moduleSpec.docstring:
A generic collection of patches.
This makes it easier to assign a color map to a heterogeneous collection of patches.
This also may improve plotting speed, since PatchCollection will draw faster than a large number of patches.

moduleSpec.name: MplTriMeshProperties
moduleSpec.docstring:
Class for the efficient drawing of a triangular mesh using Gouraud shading.
A triangular mesh is a :class:`~matplotlib.tri.Triangulation` object.

moduleSpec.name: MplQuadMeshProperties
moduleSpec.docstring:
Class for the efficient drawing of a quadrilateral mesh.
A quadrilateral mesh consists of a grid of vertices. The dimensions of this array are (*meshWidth* + 1, *meshHeight* + 1). Each vertex in the mesh has a different set of "mesh coordinates" representing its position in the topology of the mesh. For any values (*m*, *n*) such that 0 <= *m* <= *meshWidth* and 0 <= *n* <= *meshHeight*, the vertices at mesh coordinates (*m*, *n*), (*m*, *n* + 1), (*m* + 1, *n* + 1), and (*m* + 1, *n*) form one of the quadrilaterals in the mesh. There are thus (*meshWidth* * *meshHeight*) quadrilaterals in the mesh. The mesh need not be regular and the polygons need not be convex.
A quadrilateral mesh is represented by a (2 x ((*meshWidth* + 1) * (*meshHeight* + 1))) numpy array *coordinates*, where each row is the *x* and *y* coordinates of one of the vertices. To define the function that maps from a data point to its corresponding color, use the :meth:`set_cmap` method. Each of these arrays is indexed in row-major order by the mesh coordinates of the vertex (or the mesh coordinates of the lower left vertex, in the case of the colors).
For example, the first entry in *coordinates* is the coordinates of the vertex at mesh coordinates (0, 0), then the one at (0, 1), then at (0, 2) .. (0, meshWidth), (1, 0), (1, 1), and so on.
*shading* may be 'flat', or 'gouraud'

moduleSpec.name: MplPatchProperties
moduleSpec.docstring:
A patch is a 2D artist with a face color and an edge color.
If any of *edgecolor*, *facecolor*, *linewidth*, or *antialiased* are *None*, they default to their rc params setting.

inputPortSpec.name: edgecolor
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the patch edge color

inputPortSpec.name: facecolor
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the patch face color

inputPortSpec.name: path_effects
inputPortSpec.docstring: set path_effects, which should be a list of instances of matplotlib.patheffect._Base class or its derivatives.

inputPortSpec.name: color
inputPortSpec.docstring:
Set both the edgecolor and the facecolor. .. seealso:
:meth:`set_facecolor`, :meth:`set_edgecolor` For setting the edge or face color individually.

inputPortSpec.name: antialiased
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set whether to use antialiased rendering

inputPortSpec.name: hatch
inputPortSpec.docstring:
Set the hatching pattern
hatch can be one of:
/ - diagonal hatching \ - back diagonal | - vertical - - horizontal + - crossed x - crossed diagonal o - small circle O - large circle . - dots * - stars
Letters can be combined, in which case all the specified hatchings are done. If same letter repeats, it increases the density of hatching of that pattern.
Hatching is supported in the PostScript, PDF, SVG and Agg backends only.

inputPortSpec.name: alpha
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the alpha tranparency of the patch.

inputPortSpec.name: linewidth
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the patch linewidth in points

inputPortSpec.name: linestyle
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the patch linestyle

inputPortSpec.name: fill
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set whether to fill the patch

inputPortSpec.name: bounds

inputPortSpec.name: x

inputPortSpec.name: radius

inputPortSpec.name: orientation

inputPortSpec.name: numVertices

moduleSpec.name: MplPathPatchProperties

moduleSpec.name: MplPolygonProperties
moduleSpec.docstring: A general polygon patch.

moduleSpec.name: MplFancyArrowProperties
moduleSpec.docstring: Like Arrow, but lets you set head width and head height independently.

moduleSpec.name: MplWedgeProperties
moduleSpec.docstring: Wedge shaped patch.

moduleSpec.name: MplArrowProperties
moduleSpec.docstring: An arrow patch.

moduleSpec.name: MplYAArrowProperties
moduleSpec.docstring:
Yet another arrow class.
This is an arrow that is defined in display space and has a tip at *x1*, *y1* and a base at *x2*, *y2*.

inputPortSpec.name: xytip
inputPortSpec.docstring: (x, y) location of arrow tip

inputPortSpec.name: headwidth
inputPortSpec.docstring: The width of the base of the arrow head in points

inputPortSpec.name: frac
inputPortSpec.docstring: The fraction of the arrow length occupied by the head

inputPortSpec.name: figure
inputPortSpec.docstring: The :class:`~matplotlib.figure.Figure` instance (fig.dpi)

inputPortSpec.name: xybase
inputPortSpec.docstring: (x, y) location the arrow base mid point

inputPortSpec.name: width
inputPortSpec.docstring: The width of the arrow in points

moduleSpec.name: MplEllipseProperties
moduleSpec.docstring: A scale-free ellipse.

moduleSpec.name: MplCircleProperties
moduleSpec.docstring: A circle patch.

inputPortSpec.name: radius
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the radius of the circle

moduleSpec.name: MplArcProperties
moduleSpec.docstring:
An elliptical arc. Because it performs various optimizations, it can not be filled.
The arc must be used in an :class:`~matplotlib.axes.Axes` instance---it can not be added directly to a :class:`~matplotlib.figure.Figure`---because it is optimized to only render the segments that are inside the axes bounding box with high resolution.

moduleSpec.name: MplFancyBboxPatchProperties
moduleSpec.docstring:
Draw a fancy box around a rectangle with lower left at *xy*=(*x*, *y*) with specified width and height.
:class:`FancyBboxPatch` class is similar to :class:`Rectangle` class, but it draws a fancy box around the rectangle. The transformation of the rectangle box to the fancy box is delegated to the :class:`BoxTransmuterBase` and its derived classes.

inputPortSpec.name: mutation_scale
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the mutation scale.

inputPortSpec.name: bounds
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the bounds of the rectangle: l,b,w,h

inputPortSpec.name: height
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the width rectangle

inputPortSpec.name: width
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the width rectangle

inputPortSpec.name: boxstyle
inputPortSpec.docstring:
Set the box style.
boxstyle can be a string with boxstyle name with optional comma-separated attributes. Alternatively, the attrs can be provided as keywords:
set_boxstyle("round,pad=0.2") set_boxstyle("round", pad=0.2)
Old attrs simply are forgotten.
Without argument (or with boxstyle = None), it returns available box styles.

inputPortSpec.name: mutation_aspect
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the aspect ratio of the bbox mutation.

inputPortSpec.name: y
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the bottom coord of the rectangle

inputPortSpec.name: x
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the left coord of the rectangle

moduleSpec.name: MplFancyArrowPatchProperties
moduleSpec.docstring: A fancy arrow patch. It draws an arrow using the :class:ArrowStyle.

inputPortSpec.name: connectionstyle
inputPortSpec.docstring:
Set the connection style.
Old attrs simply are forgotten.
Without argument (or with connectionstyle=None), return available styles as a list of strings.

inputPortSpec.name: mutation_scale
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the mutation scale.

inputPortSpec.name: arrowstyle
inputPortSpec.docstring:
Set the arrow style.
Old attrs simply are forgotten.
Without argument (or with arrowstyle=None), return available box styles as a list of strings.

inputPortSpec.name: dpi_cor
inputPortSpec.docstring: dpi_cor is currently used for linewidth-related things and shink factor. Mutation scale is not affected by this.

inputPortSpec.name: mutation_aspect
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the aspect ratio of the bbox mutation.

inputPortSpec.name: patchA
inputPortSpec.docstring: set the begin patch.

inputPortSpec.name: patchB
inputPortSpec.docstring: set the begin patch

set annotation_clip attribute.
None: the self.xy will be checked only if xycoords is "data"

moduleSpec.name: MplLine2DProperties
moduleSpec.docstring: A line - the line can have both a solid linestyle connecting all the vertices, and a marker at each vertex. Additionally, the drawing of the solid line is influenced by the drawstyle, eg one can create "stepped" lines in various styles.

inputPortSpec.name: picker
inputPortSpec.docstring: Sets the event picker details for the line.

inputPortSpec.name: dash_capstyle
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the cap style for dashed linestyles

inputPortSpec.name: color
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the color of the line

inputPortSpec.name: markevery
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the markevery property to subsample the plot when using markers. Eg if markevery=5, every 5-th marker will be plotted. every can be

inputPortSpec.name: markeredgecolor
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the marker edge color

inputPortSpec.name: marker
inputPortSpec.docstring:
Set the line marker
The marker can also be a tuple (numsides, style, angle), which will create a custom, regular symbol.
For backward compatibility, the form (verts, 0) is also accepted, but it is equivalent to just verts for giving a raw set of vertices that define the shape.
inputPortSpec.translations: {'caretright': 5, 'point': '.', 'triangle_right': '>', 'tickup': 2, 'square': 's', 'vline': '|', 'caretleft': 4, 'pentagon': 'p', 'tri_left': '3', 'x': 'x', 'tickright': 1, 'tri_right': '4', 'see below': '(numsides, style, angle)', 'tickleft': 0, 'tri_up': '2', 'circle': 'o', 'pixel': ',', 'diamond': 'D', 'star': '*', 'hexagon1': 'h', 'hexagon2': 'H', 'octagon': '8', 'tickdown': 3, 'nothing': ' ', 'render the string using mathtext.': '$...$', 'thin_diamond': 'd', 'tri_down': '1', 'triangle_left': '<', 'a list of (x, y) pairs used for Path vertices.': 'verts', 'caretdown': 7, 'hline': '_', 'plus': '+', 'triangle_down': 'v', 'triangle_up': '^', 'a :class:`~matplotlib.path.Path` instance.': 'path', 'caretup': 6}
inputPortSpec.values: [['caretdown', 'caretleft', 'caretright', 'caretup', 'circle', 'diamond', 'hexagon1', 'hexagon2', 'hline', 'nothing', 'nothing', 'nothing', 'nothing', 'octagon', 'pentagon', 'pixel', 'plus', 'point', 'square', 'star', 'thin_diamond', 'tickdown', 'tickleft', 'tickright', 'tickup', 'tri_down', 'tri_left', 'tri_right', 'tri_up', 'triangle_down', 'triangle_left', 'triangle_right', 'triangle_up', 'vline', 'x', 'render the string using mathtext.', 'a list of (x, y) pairs used for Path vertices.', 'a :class:`~matplotlib.path.Path` instance.', 'see below']]

inputPortSpec.name: markerfacecoloralt
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the alternate marker face color.

inputPortSpec.name: linestyle

Set the linestyle of the line (also accepts drawstyles)
'steps' is equivalent to 'steps-pre' and is maintained for backward-compatibility.

inputPortSpec.name: solid_joinstyle
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the join style for solid linestyles

inputPortSpec.name: markerfacecolor
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the marker face color.

inputPortSpec.name: axes
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the :class:`~matplotlib.axes.Axes` instance in which the artist resides, if any.

inputPortSpec.name: transform
inputPortSpec.docstring: set the Transformation instance used by this artist

inputPortSpec.name: fillstyle
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the marker fill style; 'full' means fill the whole marker. 'none' means no filling; other options are for half-filled markers.

inputPortSpec.name: markeredgewidth
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the marker edge width in points

inputPortSpec.name: solid_capstyle
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the cap style for solid linestyles

inputPortSpec.name: dashes
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the dash sequence, sequence of dashes with on off ink in points. If seq is empty or if seq = (None, None), the linestyle will be set to solid.

inputPortSpec.name: markersize
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the marker size in points

inputPortSpec.name: antialiased
inputPortSpec.docstring: True if line should be drawin with antialiased rendering

inputPortSpec.name: xdata
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the data np.array for x

inputPortSpec.name: drawstyle
inputPortSpec.docstring:
Set the drawstyle of the plot
'default' connects the points with lines. The steps variants produce step-plots. 'steps' is equivalent to 'steps-pre' and is maintained for backward-compatibility.

inputPortSpec.name: data
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the x and y data

inputPortSpec.name: dash_joinstyle
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the join style for dashed linestyles

inputPortSpec.name: pickradius
inputPortSpec.docstring: Sets the pick radius used for containment tests

inputPortSpec.name: ydata
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the data np.array for y

moduleSpec.name: MplTextProperties
moduleSpec.docstring: Handle storing and drawing of text in window or data coordinates.

inputPortSpec.name: rotation_mode
inputPortSpec.docstring: set text rotation mode. If "anchor", the un-rotated text will first aligned according to their ha and va, and then will be rotated with the alignement reference point as a origin. If None (default), the text will be rotated first then will be aligned.

inputPortSpec.name: style
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the font style.

inputPortSpec.name: linespacing
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the line spacing as a multiple of the font size. Default is 1.2.

inputPortSpec.name: family
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the font family. May be either a single string, or a list of strings in decreasing priority. Each string may be either a real font name or a generic font class name. If the latter, the specific font names will be looked up in the :file:`matplotlibrc` file.

inputPortSpec.name: x
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the x position of the text

inputPortSpec.name: color
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the foreground color of the text

inputPortSpec.name: text
inputPortSpec.docstring:
Set the text string s
It may contain newlines (\n) or math in LaTeX syntax.

inputPortSpec.name: verticalalignment
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the vertical alignment

inputPortSpec.name: variant
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the font variant, either 'normal' or 'small-caps'.

inputPortSpec.name: weight
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the font weight.

inputPortSpec.name: stretch
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the font stretch (horizontal condensation or expansion).

inputPortSpec.name: fontproperties
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the font properties that control the text. fp must be a :class:`matplotlib.font_manager.FontProperties` object.

inputPortSpec.name: horizontalalignment
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the horizontal alignment to one of

inputPortSpec.name: bbox
inputPortSpec.docstring:
Draw a bounding box around self. rectprops are any settable properties for a rectangle, eg facecolor='red', alpha=0.5.
t.set_bbox(dict(facecolor='red', alpha=0.5))
If rectprops has "boxstyle" key. A FancyBboxPatch is initialized with rectprops and will be drawn. The mutation scale of the FancyBboxPath is set to the fontsize.

inputPortSpec.name: backgroundcolor
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the background color of the text by updating the bbox.

inputPortSpec.name: position
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the (x, y) position of the text

inputPortSpec.name: y
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the y position of the text

inputPortSpec.name: multialignment
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the alignment for multiple lines layout. The layout of the bounding box of all the lines is determined bu the horizontalalignment and verticalalignment properties, but the multiline text within that box can be

inputPortSpec.name: rotation
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the rotation of the text

inputPortSpec.name: size
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the font size. May be either a size string, relative to the default font size, or an absolute font size in points.

moduleSpec.name: MplTextWithDashProperties
moduleSpec.docstring:
This is basically a :class:`~matplotlib.text.Text` with a dash (drawn with a :class:`~matplotlib.lines.Line2D`) before/after it. It is intended to be a drop-in replacement for :class:`~matplotlib.text.Text`, and should behave identically to it when *dashlength* = 0.0.
The dash always comes between the point specified by :meth:`~matplotlib.text.Text.set_position` and the text. When a dash exists, the text alignment arguments (*horizontalalignment*, *verticalalignment*) are ignored.
*dashlength* is the length of the dash in canvas units. (default = 0.0).
*dashdirection* is one of 0 or 1, where 0 draws the dash after the text and 1 before. (default = 0).
*dashrotation* specifies the rotation of the dash, and should generally stay *None*. In this case :meth:`~matplotlib.text.TextWithDash.get_dashrotation` returns :meth:`~matplotlib.text.Text.get_rotation`. (I.e., the dash takes its rotation from the text's rotation). Because the text center is projected onto the dash, major deviations in the rotation cause what may be considered visually unappealing results. (default = *None*)
*dashpad* is a padding length to add (or subtract) space between the text and the dash, in canvas units. (default = 3)
*dashpush* "pushes" the dash and text away from the point specified by :meth:`~matplotlib.text.Text.set_position` by the amount in canvas units. (default = 0)
.. note::
The alignment of the two objects is based on the bounding box of the :class:`~matplotlib.text.Text`, as obtained by :meth:`~matplotlib.artist.Artist.get_window_extent`. This, in turn, appears to depend on the font metrics as given by the rendering backend. Hence the quality of the "centering" of the label text with respect to the dash varies depending on the backend used.
.. note::
I'm not sure that I got the :meth:`~matplotlib.text.TextWithDash.get_window_extent` right, or whether that's sufficient for providing the object bounding box.

inputPortSpec.name: dashpush
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the "push" of the TextWithDash, which is the extra spacing between the beginning of the dash and the specified position.

inputPortSpec.name: dashdirection
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the direction of the dash following the text. 1 is before the text and 0 is after. The default is 0, which is what you'd want for the typical case of ticks below and on the left of the figure.

inputPortSpec.name: figure
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the figure instance the artist belong to.

inputPortSpec.name: dashpad
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the "pad" of the TextWithDash, which is the extra spacing between the dash and the text, in canvas units.

inputPortSpec.name: dashrotation
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the rotation of the dash, in degrees

inputPortSpec.name: transform
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the :class:`matplotlib.transforms.Transform` instance used by this artist.

inputPortSpec.name: x
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the x position of the :class:`TextWithDash`.

inputPortSpec.name: y
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the y position of the :class:`TextWithDash`.

inputPortSpec.name: position
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the (x, y) position of the :class:`TextWithDash`.

inputPortSpec.name: dashlength
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the length of the dash.

moduleSpec.name: MplTickProperties
moduleSpec.docstring:
Abstract base class for the axis ticks, grid lines and labels
1 refers to the bottom of the plot for xticks and the left for yticks 2 refers to the top of the plot for xticks and the right for yticks
Publicly accessible attributes:
:attr:`tick1line` a Line2D instance
:attr:`tick2line` a Line2D instance
:attr:`gridline` a Line2D instance
:attr:`label1` a Text instance
:attr:`label2` a Text instance
:attr:`gridOn` a boolean which determines whether to draw the tickline
:attr:`tick1On` a boolean which determines whether to draw the 1st tickline
:attr:`tick2On` a boolean which determines whether to draw the 2nd tickline
:attr:`label1On` a boolean which determines whether to draw tick label
:attr:`label2On` a boolean which determines whether to draw tick label

inputPortSpec.name: label1
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the text of ticklabel

inputPortSpec.name: label2
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the text of ticklabel2

inputPortSpec.name: clip_path
inputPortSpec.docstring:
Set the artist's clip path, which may be:
a :class:`~matplotlib.patches.Patch` (or subclass) instance
None, to remove the clipping path
For efficiency, if the path happens to be an axis-aligned rectangle, this method will set the clipping box to the corresponding rectangle and set the clipping path to None.

inputPortSpec.name: label
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the text of ticklabel

inputPortSpec.name: pad
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the tick label pad in points

moduleSpec.name: MplXTickProperties
moduleSpec.docstring: Contains all the Artists needed to make an x tick - the tick line, the label text and the grid line

moduleSpec.name: MplYTickProperties
moduleSpec.docstring: Contains all the Artists needed to make a Y tick - the tick line, the label text and the grid line

moduleSpec.name: MplAxisProperties
moduleSpec.docstring:
Public attributes
* :attr:`axes.transData` - transform data coords to display coords * :attr:`axes.transAxes` - transform axis coords to display coords * :attr:`labelpad` - number of points between the axis and its label

inputPortSpec.name: pickradius
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the depth of the axis used by the picker

inputPortSpec.name: minor_formatter
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the formatter of the minor ticker

inputPortSpec.name: smart_bounds
inputPortSpec.docstring: set the axis to have smart bounds

inputPortSpec.name: ticksSequence
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the locations of the tick marks from sequence ticks

inputPortSpec.name: major_locator
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the locator of the major ticker

inputPortSpec.name: major_formatter
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the formatter of the major ticker

inputPortSpec.name: ticklabelsSequence
inputPortSpec.docstring:
Set the text values of the tick labels. Return a list of Text instances. Use kwarg minor=True to select minor ticks. All other kwargs are used to update the text object properties. As for get_ticklabels, label1 (left or bottom) is affected for a given tick only if its label1On attribute is True, and similarly for label2. The list of returned label text objects consists of all such label1 objects followed by all such label2 objects.
The input ticklabels is assumed to match the set of tick locations, regardless of the state of label1On and label2On.

inputPortSpec.name: minor_locator
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the locator of the minor ticker

inputPortSpec.name: data_interval
inputPortSpec.docstring: set the axis data limits

inputPortSpec.name: label_text
inputPortSpec.docstring: Sets the text value of the axis label

inputPortSpec.name: label_coords
inputPortSpec.docstring:
Set the coordinates of the label. By default, the x coordinate of the y label is determined by the tick label bounding boxes, but this can lead to poor alignment of multiple ylabels if there are multiple axes. Ditto for the y coodinate of the x label.
You can also specify the coordinate system of the label with the transform. If None, the default coordinate system will be the axes coordinate system (0,0) is (left,bottom), (0.5, 0.5) is middle, etc

inputPortSpec.name: units
inputPortSpec.docstring: set the units for axis

inputPortSpec.name: tick_params
inputPortSpec.docstring:
Set appearance parameters for ticks and ticklabels.
For documentation of keyword arguments, see :meth:`matplotlib.axes.Axes.tick_params`.

moduleSpec.name: MplXAxisProperties
moduleSpec.docstring: None

inputPortSpec.name: view_interval
inputPortSpec.docstring: If ignore is False, the order of vmin, vmax does not matter; the original axis orientation will be preserved. In addition, the view limits can be expanded, but will not be reduced. This method is for mpl internal use; for normal use, see :meth:`~matplotlib.axes.Axes.set_xlim`.

inputPortSpec.name: ticks_position
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the ticks position (top, bottom, both, default or none) both sets the ticks to appear on both positions, but does not change the tick labels. 'default' resets the tick positions to the default: ticks on both positions, labels at bottom. 'none' can be used if you don't want any ticks. 'none' and 'both' affect only the ticks, not the labels.

inputPortSpec.name: label_position
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the label position (top or bottom)

inputPortSpec.name: default_intervals
inputPortSpec.docstring: set the default limits for the axis interval if they are not mutated

inputPortSpec.name: data_interval
inputPortSpec.docstring: set the axis data limits

moduleSpec.name: MplYAxisProperties
moduleSpec.docstring: None

inputPortSpec.name: view_interval
inputPortSpec.docstring: If ignore is False, the order of vmin, vmax does not matter; the original axis orientation will be preserved. In addition, the view limits can be expanded, but will not be reduced. This method is for mpl internal use; for normal use, see :meth:`~matplotlib.axes.Axes.set_ylim`.

inputPortSpec.name: ticks_position
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the ticks position (left, right, both, default or none) 'both' sets the ticks to appear on both positions, but does not change the tick labels. 'default' resets the tick positions to the default: ticks on both positions, labels at left. 'none' can be used if you don't want any ticks. 'none' and 'both' affect only the ticks, not the labels.

inputPortSpec.name: label_position
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the label position (left or right)

inputPortSpec.name: default_intervals
inputPortSpec.docstring: set the default limits for the axis interval if they are not mutated

inputPortSpec.name: data_interval
inputPortSpec.docstring: set the axis data limits

moduleSpec.name: MplLegendProperties
moduleSpec.docstring:
Place a legend on the axes at location loc. Labels are a sequence of strings and loc can be a string or an integer specifying the legend location
The location codes are::
'best' : 0, (only implemented for axis legends) 'upper right' : 1, 'upper left' : 2, 'lower left' : 3, 'lower right' : 4, 'right' : 5, 'center left' : 6, 'center right' : 7, 'lower center' : 8, 'upper center' : 9, 'center' : 10,
loc can be a tuple of the noramilzed coordinate values with respect its parent.

inputPortSpec.name: bbox_to_anchor
inputPortSpec.docstring:
set the bbox that the legend will be anchored.
bbox can be a BboxBase instance, a tuple of [left, bottom, width, height] in the given transform (normalized axes coordinate if None), or a tuple of [left, bottom] where the width and height will be assumed to be zero.

inputPortSpec.name: title
inputPortSpec.docstring: set the legend title. Fontproperties can be optionally set with prop parameter.

inputPortSpec.name: frame_on
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set whether the legend box patch is drawn

inputPortSpec.name: default_handler_map
inputPortSpec.docstring: A class method to set the default handler map.

moduleSpec.name: MplAxesProperties
moduleSpec.docstring:
The :class:`Axes` contains most of the figure elements: :class:`~matplotlib.axis.Axis`, :class:`~matplotlib.axis.Tick`, :class:`~matplotlib.lines.Line2D`, :class:`~matplotlib.text.Text`, :class:`~matplotlib.patches.Polygon`, etc., and sets the coordinate system.
The :class:`Axes` instance supports callbacks through a callbacks attribute which is a :class:`~matplotlib.cbook.CallbackRegistry` instance. The events you can connect to are 'xlim_changed' and 'ylim_changed' and the callback will be called with func(*ax*) where *ax* is the :class:`Axes` instance.

inputPortSpec.name: cursor_props
inputPortSpec.docstring:
Set the cursor property as:
ax.set_cursor_props(linewidth, color)
or:
ax.set_cursor_props((linewidth, color))

inputPortSpec.name: figure
inputPortSpec.docstring:
Set the class:~matplotlib.axes.Axes figure
accepts a class:~matplotlib.figure.Figure instance

inputPortSpec.name: yscale
inputPortSpec.docstring:
Call signature:
set_yscale(value)
Set the scaling of the y-axis: 'linear' | 'log' | 'symlog' Different kwargs are accepted, depending on the scale: 'linear'
'log'
'symlog'

inputPortSpec.name: navigate
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set whether the axes responds to navigation toolbar commands

inputPortSpec.name: aspect
inputPortSpec.docstring:
aspect
adjustable
'box' does not allow axes sharing, as this can cause unintended side effect. For cases when sharing axes is fine, use 'box-forced'.
anchor

inputPortSpec.name: axis_bgcolor
inputPortSpec.docstring: set the axes background color

inputPortSpec.name: ylimSequence
inputPortSpec.docstring:
Call signature:
set_ylim(self, *args, **kwargs):
Set the data limits for the yaxis
Examples:
set_ylim((bottom, top)) set_ylim(bottom, top) set_ylim(bottom=1) # top unchanged set_ylim(top=1) # bottom unchanged
Keyword arguments:
Note, the bottom (formerly ymin) value may be greater than the top (formerly ymax). For example, suppose y is depth in the ocean. Then one might use:
set_ylim(5000, 0)
so 5000 m depth is at the bottom of the plot and the surface, 0 m, is at the top.
Returns the current ylimits as a length 2 tuple

inputPortSpec.name: xlimSequence
inputPortSpec.docstring:
Call signature:
set_xlim(self, *args, **kwargs):
Set the data limits for the xaxis
Examples:
set_xlim((left, right)) set_xlim(left, right) set_xlim(left=1) # right unchanged set_xlim(right=1) # left unchanged
Keyword arguments:
Note, the left (formerly xmin) value may be greater than the right (formerly xmax). For example, suppose x is years before present. Then one might use:
set_ylim(5000, 0)
so 5000 years ago is on the left of the plot and the present is on the right.
Returns the current xlimits as a length 2 tuple

inputPortSpec.name: axis_on
inputPortSpec.docstring: turn on the axis

inputPortSpec.name: title
inputPortSpec.docstring:
Call signature:
set_title(label, fontdict=None, **kwargs):
Set the title for the axes.

inputPortSpec.name: xticksSequence
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the x ticks with list of ticks

inputPortSpec.name: ylabel
inputPortSpec.docstring:
Call signature:
set_ylabel(ylabel, fontdict=None, labelpad=None, **kwargs)
Set the label for the yaxis
labelpad is the spacing in points between the label and the y-axis

inputPortSpec.name: autoscalex_on
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set whether autoscaling for the x-axis is applied on plot commands

inputPortSpec.name: rasterization_zorder
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set zorder value below which artists will be rasterized. Set to None to disable rasterizing of artists below a particular zorder.

inputPortSpec.name: axes_locator
inputPortSpec.docstring: set axes_locator

inputPortSpec.name: axisbelow
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set whether the axis ticks and gridlines are above or below most artists

inputPortSpec.name: frame_on
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set whether the axes rectangle patch is drawn

inputPortSpec.name: navigate_mode
inputPortSpec.docstring:
Set the navigation toolbar button status;
this is not a user-API function.

inputPortSpec.name: xscale
inputPortSpec.docstring:
Call signature:
set_xscale(value)
Set the scaling of the x-axis: 'linear' | 'log' | 'symlog' Different kwargs are accepted, depending on the scale: 'linear'
'log'
'symlog'

inputPortSpec.name: axis_off
inputPortSpec.docstring: turn off the axis

inputPortSpec.name: autoscale_on
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set whether autoscaling is applied on plot commands

inputPortSpec.name: ybound
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the lower and upper numerical bounds of the y-axis. This method will honor axes inversion regardless of parameter order. It will not change the _autoscaleYon attribute.

inputPortSpec.name: yticklabelsSequence
inputPortSpec.docstring:
Call signature:
set_yticklabels(labels, fontdict=None, minor=False, **kwargs)
Set the y tick labels with list of strings labels. Return a list of :class:`~matplotlib.text.Text` instances.
kwargs set :class:`~matplotlib.text.Text` properties for the labels. Valid properties are
agg_filter: unknown alpha: float (0.0 transparent through 1.0 opaque) animated: [True | False] axes: an :class:`~matplotlib.axes.Axes` instance backgroundcolor: any matplotlib color bbox: rectangle prop dict clip_box: a :class:`matplotlib.transforms.Bbox` instance clip_on: [True | False] clip_path: [ (:class:`~matplotlib.path.Path`, :class:`~matplotlib.transforms.Transform`) | :class:`~matplotlib.patches.Patch` | None ] color: any matplotlib color contains: a callable function family or fontfamily or fontname or name: [ FONTNAME | 'serif' | 'sans-serif' | 'cursive' | 'fantasy' | 'monospace' ] figure: a :class:`matplotlib.figure.Figure` instance fontproperties or font_properties: a :class:`matplotlib.font_manager.FontProperties` instance gid: an id string horizontalalignment or ha: [ 'center' | 'right' | 'left' ] label: string or anything printable with '%s' conversion. linespacing: float (multiple of font size) lod: [True | False] multialignment: ['left' | 'right' | 'center' ] path_effects: unknown picker: [None|float|boolean|callable] position: (x,y) rasterized: [True | False | None] rotation: [ angle in degrees | 'vertical' | 'horizontal' ] rotation_mode: unknown size or fontsize: [ size in points | 'xx-small' | 'x-small' | 'small' | 'medium' | 'large' | 'x-large' | 'xx-large' ] snap: unknown stretch or fontstretch: [ a numeric value in range 0-1000 | 'ultra-condensed' | 'extra-condensed' | 'condensed' | 'semi-condensed' | 'normal' | 'semi-expanded' | 'expanded' | 'extra-expanded' | 'ultra-expanded' ] style or fontstyle: [ 'normal' | 'italic' | 'oblique'] text: string or anything printable with '%s' conversion. transform: :class:`~matplotlib.transforms.Transform` instance url: a url string variant or fontvariant: [ 'normal' | 'small-caps' ] verticalalignment or va or ma: [ 'center' | 'top' | 'bottom' | 'baseline' ] visible: [True | False] weight or fontweight: [ a numeric value in range 0-1000 | 'ultralight' | 'light' | 'normal' | 'regular' | 'book' | 'medium' | 'roman' | 'semibold' | 'demibold' | 'demi' | 'bold' | 'heavy' | 'extra bold' | 'black' ] x: float y: float zorder: any number

inputPortSpec.name: autoscaley_on
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set whether autoscaling for the y-axis is applied on plot commands

inputPortSpec.name: xmargin
inputPortSpec.docstring:
Set padding of X data limits prior to autoscaling.
m times the data interval will be added to each end of that interval before it is used in autoscaling.

inputPortSpec.name: color_cycle
inputPortSpec.docstring:
Set the color cycle for any future plot commands on this Axes.
clist is a list of mpl color specifiers.

inputPortSpec.name: xlabel
inputPortSpec.docstring:
Call signature:
set_xlabel(xlabel, fontdict=None, labelpad=None, **kwargs)
Set the label for the xaxis.
labelpad is the spacing in points between the label and the x-axis

inputPortSpec.name: xbound
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the lower and upper numerical bounds of the x-axis. This method will honor axes inversion regardless of parameter order. It will not change the _autoscaleXon attribute.

inputPortSpec.name: yticksSequence
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the y ticks with list of ticks Keyword arguments:

inputPortSpec.name: ymargin
inputPortSpec.docstring:
Set padding of Y data limits prior to autoscaling.
m times the data interval will be added to each end of that interval before it is used in autoscaling.

inputPortSpec.name: position
inputPortSpec.docstring:
Set the axes position with:
pos = [left, bottom, width, height]
in relative 0,1 coords, or pos can be a :class:`~matplotlib.transforms.Bbox`
There are two position variables: one which is ultimately used, but which may be modified by :meth:`apply_aspect`, and a second which is the starting point for :meth:`apply_aspect`.

inputPortSpec.name: anchor
inputPortSpec.docstring: anchor

inputPortSpec.name: xticklabelsSequence
inputPortSpec.docstring:
Call signature:
set_xticklabels(labels, fontdict=None, minor=False, **kwargs)
Set the xtick labels with list of strings labels. Return a list of axis text instances.
kwargs set the :class:`~matplotlib.text.Text` properties. Valid properties are
agg_filter: unknown alpha: float (0.0 transparent through 1.0 opaque) animated: [True | False] axes: an :class:`~matplotlib.axes.Axes` instance backgroundcolor: any matplotlib color bbox: rectangle prop dict clip_box: a :class:`matplotlib.transforms.Bbox` instance clip_on: [True | False] clip_path: [ (:class:`~matplotlib.path.Path`, :class:`~matplotlib.transforms.Transform`) | :class:`~matplotlib.patches.Patch` | None ] color: any matplotlib color contains: a callable function family or fontfamily or fontname or name: [ FONTNAME | 'serif' | 'sans-serif' | 'cursive' | 'fantasy' | 'monospace' ] figure: a :class:`matplotlib.figure.Figure` instance fontproperties or font_properties: a :class:`matplotlib.font_manager.FontProperties` instance gid: an id string horizontalalignment or ha: [ 'center' | 'right' | 'left' ] label: string or anything printable with '%s' conversion. linespacing: float (multiple of font size) lod: [True | False] multialignment: ['left' | 'right' | 'center' ] path_effects: unknown picker: [None|float|boolean|callable] position: (x,y) rasterized: [True | False | None] rotation: [ angle in degrees | 'vertical' | 'horizontal' ] rotation_mode: unknown size or fontsize: [ size in points | 'xx-small' | 'x-small' | 'small' | 'medium' | 'large' | 'x-large' | 'xx-large' ] snap: unknown stretch or fontstretch: [ a numeric value in range 0-1000 | 'ultra-condensed' | 'extra-condensed' | 'condensed' | 'semi-condensed' | 'normal' | 'semi-expanded' | 'expanded' | 'extra-expanded' | 'ultra-expanded' ] style or fontstyle: [ 'normal' | 'italic' | 'oblique'] text: string or anything printable with '%s' conversion. transform: :class:`~matplotlib.transforms.Transform` instance url: a url string variant or fontvariant: [ 'normal' | 'small-caps' ] verticalalignment or va or ma: [ 'center' | 'top' | 'bottom' | 'baseline' ] visible: [True | False] weight or fontweight: [ a numeric value in range 0-1000 | 'ultralight' | 'light' | 'normal' | 'regular' | 'book' | 'medium' | 'roman' | 'semibold' | 'demibold' | 'demi' | 'bold' | 'heavy' | 'extra bold' | 'black' ] x: float y: float zorder: any number

moduleSpec.name: MplAxesSubplotProperties
moduleSpec.docstring: None

moduleSpec.name: MplFigureProperties
moduleSpec.docstring:
The Figure instance supports callbacks through a *callbacks* attribute which is a :class:`matplotlib.cbook.CallbackRegistry` instance. The events you can connect to are 'dpi_changed', and the callback will be called with ``func(fig)`` where fig is the :class:`Figure` instance.
*patch* The figure patch is drawn by a :class:`matplotlib.patches.Rectangle` instance
*suppressComposite* For multiple figure images, the figure will make composite images depending on the renderer option_image_nocomposite function. If suppressComposite is True|False, this will override the renderer.

inputPortSpec.name: edgecolor
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the edge color of the Figure rectangle

inputPortSpec.name: canvas
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the canvas the contains the figure

inputPortSpec.name: facecolor
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the face color of the Figure rectangle

inputPortSpec.name: size_inches
inputPortSpec.docstring:
set_size_inches(w,h, forward=False)
Set the figure size in inches
Usage:
fig.set_size_inches(w,h) # OR fig.set_size_inches((w,h) )
optional kwarg forward=True will cause the canvas size to be automatically updated; eg you can resize the figure window from the shell

inputPortSpec.name: figwidth
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the width of the figure in inches

inputPortSpec.name: frameon
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set whether the figure frame (background) is displayed or invisible

inputPortSpec.name: figheight
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the height of the figure in inches

inputPortSpec.name: tight_layout
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set whether :meth:`tight_layout` is used upon drawing. If None, the rcParams['figure.autolayout'] value will be set.

inputPortSpec.name: dpi
inputPortSpec.docstring: Set the dots-per-inch of the figure

moduleSpec.name: MplAnnotationProperties
moduleSpec.docstring: A :class:`~matplotlib.text.Text` class to make annotating things in the figure, such as :class:`~matplotlib.figure.Figure`, :class:`~matplotlib.axes.Axes`, :class:`~matplotlib.patches.Rectangle`, etc., easier.

inputPortSpec.name: xycoords
inputPortSpec.values: [['figure points', 'figure pixels', 'figure fraction', 'axes points', 'axes pixels', 'axes fraction', 'data', 'offset points', 'polar']]

inputPortSpec.name: textcoords
inputPortSpec.values: [['figure points', 'figure pixels', 'figure fraction', 'axes points', 'axes pixels', 'axes fraction', 'data', 'offset points', 'polar']]
